005package edu.wpi.first.units;
006
007import static edu.wpi.first.units.Units.Value;
008
009import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Acceleration;
010import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Angle;
011import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.AngularAcceleration;
012import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.AngularMomentum;
013import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.AngularVelocity;
014import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Current;
015import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Dimensionless;
016import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Distance;
017import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Energy;
018import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Force;
019import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Frequency;
020import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.LinearAcceleration;
021import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.LinearMomentum;
022import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.LinearVelocity;
023import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Mass;
024import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.MomentOfInertia;
025import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Mult;
026import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Per;
027import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Power;
028import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Temperature;
029import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Time;
030import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Torque;
031import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Velocity;
032import edu.wpi.first.units.measure.Voltage;
033
034/**
035 * A measure holds the magnitude and unit of some dimension, such as distance, time, or speed. Two
036 * measures with the same <i>unit</i> and <i>magnitude</i> are effectively equivalent objects.
037 *
038 * @param <U> the unit type of the measure
039 */
040public interface Measure<U extends Unit> extends Comparable<Measure<U>> {
041  /**
042   * The threshold for two measures to be considered equivalent if converted to the same unit. This
043   * is only needed due to floating-point error.
044   */
045  double EQUIVALENCE_THRESHOLD = 1e-12;
046
047  /**
048   * Gets the unitless magnitude of this measure.
049   *
050   * @return the magnitude in terms of {@link #unit() the unit}.
051   */
052  double magnitude();
053
054  /**
055   * Gets the magnitude of this measure in terms of the base unit. If the unit is the base unit for
056   * its system of measure, then the value will be equivalent to {@link #magnitude()}.
057   *
058   * @return the magnitude in terms of the base unit
059   */
060  double baseUnitMagnitude();
061
062  /**
063   * Gets the units of this measure.
064   *
065   * @return the unit
066   */
067  U unit();
068
069  /**
070   * Converts this measure to a measure with a different unit of the same type, eg minutes to
071   * seconds. Converting to the same unit is equivalent to calling {@link #magnitude()}.
072   *
073   * <pre>
074   *   Meters.of(12).in(Feet) // 39.3701
075   *   Seconds.of(15).in(Minutes) // 0.25
076   * </pre>
077   *
078   * @param unit the unit to convert this measure to
079   * @return the value of this measure in the given unit
080   */
081  default double in(U unit) {
082    if (this.unit().equals(unit)) {
083      return magnitude();
084    } else {
085      return unit.fromBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude());
086    }
087  }
088
089  /**
090   * A convenience method to get the base unit of the measurement. Equivalent to {@code
091   * unit().getBaseUnit()}.
092   *
093   * @return the base unit of measure.
094   */
095  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
096  default U baseUnit() {
097    return (U) unit().getBaseUnit();
098  }
099
100  /**
101   * Returns an immutable copy of this measure. The copy can be used freely and is guaranteed never
102   * to change.
103   *
104   * @return the copied measure
105   */
106  Measure<U> copy();
107
108  /**
109   * Returns a mutable copy of this measure. It will be initialized to the current state of this
110   * measure, but can be changed over time without needing to allocate new measurement objects.
111   *
112   * @return the copied measure
113   */
114  MutableMeasure<U, ?, ?> mutableCopy();
115
116  /**
117   * Returns a measure equivalent to this one equal to zero minus its current value. For non-linear
118   * unit types like temperature, the zero point is treated as the zero value of the base unit (eg
119   * Kelvin). In effect, this means code like {@code Celsius.of(10).unaryMinus()} returns a value
120   * equivalent to -10 Kelvin, and <i>not</i> -10Â° Celsius.
121   *
122   * @return a measure equal to zero minus this measure
123   */
124  Measure<U> unaryMinus();
125
126  /**
127   * Adds another measure of the same unit type to this one.
128   *
129   * @param other the measurement to add
130   * @return a measure of the sum of both measures
131   */
132  Measure<U> plus(Measure<? extends U> other);
133
134  /**
135   * Subtracts another measure of the same unit type from this one.
136   *
137   * @param other the measurement to subtract
138   * @return a measure of the difference between the measures
139   */
140  Measure<U> minus(Measure<? extends U> other);
141
142  /**
143   * Multiplies this measure by a scalar unitless multiplier.
144   *
145   * @param multiplier the scalar multiplication factor
146   * @return the scaled result
147   */
148  Measure<U> times(double multiplier);
149
150  /**
151   * Multiplies this measure by a scalar dimensionless multiplier.
152   *
153   * @param multiplier the scalar multiplication factor
154   * @return the scaled result
155   */
156  Measure<U> times(Dimensionless multiplier);
157
158  /**
159   * Generates a new measure that is equal to this measure multiplied by another. Some dimensional
160   * analysis is performed to reduce the units down somewhat; for example, multiplying a {@code
161   * Measure<Time>} by a {@code Measure<Velocity<Distance>>} will return just a {@code
162   * Measure<Distance>} instead of the naive {@code Measure<Mult<Time, Velocity<Distance>>}. This is
163   * not guaranteed to perform perfect dimensional analysis.
164   *
165   * @param multiplier the unit to multiply by
166   * @return the multiplicative unit
167   */
168  default Measure<?> times(Measure<?> multiplier) {
169    final double baseUnitResult = baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude();
170
171    // First try to eliminate any common units
172    if (unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> ratio
173        && multiplier.baseUnit().equals(ratio.denominator().getBaseUnit())) {
174      // Per<N, D> * D -> yield N
175      // Case 1: denominator of the Per cancels out, return with just the units of the numerator
176      return ratio.numerator().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
177    } else if (multiplier.baseUnit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> ratio
178        && baseUnit().equals(ratio.denominator().getBaseUnit())) {
179      // D * Per<N, D) -> yield N
180      // Case 2: Same as Case 1, just flipped between this and the multiplier
181      return ratio.numerator().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
182    } else if (unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> per
183        && multiplier.unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> otherPer
184        && per.denominator().getBaseUnit().equals(otherPer.numerator().getBaseUnit())
185        && per.numerator().getBaseUnit().equals(otherPer.denominator().getBaseUnit())) {
186      // multiplying eg meters per second * milliseconds per foot
187      // return a scalar
188      return Value.of(baseUnitResult);
189    }
190
191    // No common units to eliminate, is one of them dimensionless?
192    // Note that this must come *after* the multiplier cases, otherwise
193    // Per<U, Dimensionless> * Dimensionless will not return a U
194    if (multiplier.unit() instanceof DimensionlessUnit) {
195      // scalar multiplication of this
196      return times(multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
197    } else if (unit() instanceof DimensionlessUnit) {
198      // scalar multiplication of multiplier
199      return multiplier.times(baseUnitMagnitude());
200    }
201
202    if (multiplier instanceof Acceleration<?> acceleration) {
203      return times(acceleration);
204    } else if (multiplier instanceof Angle angle) {
205      return times(angle);
206    } else if (multiplier instanceof AngularAcceleration angularAcceleration) {
207      return times(angularAcceleration);
208    } else if (multiplier instanceof AngularMomentum angularMomentum) {
209      return times(angularMomentum);
210    } else if (multiplier instanceof AngularVelocity angularVelocity) {
211      return times(angularVelocity);
212    } else if (multiplier instanceof Current current) {
213      return times(current);
214    } else if (multiplier instanceof Dimensionless dimensionless) {
215      // n.b. this case should already be covered
216      return times(dimensionless);
217    } else if (multiplier instanceof Distance distance) {
218      return times(distance);
219    } else if (multiplier instanceof Energy energy) {
220      return times(energy);
221    } else if (multiplier instanceof Force force) {
222      return times(force);
223    } else if (multiplier instanceof Frequency frequency) {
224      return times(frequency);
225    } else if (multiplier instanceof LinearAcceleration linearAcceleration) {
226      return times(linearAcceleration);
227    } else if (multiplier instanceof LinearVelocity linearVelocity) {
228      return times(linearVelocity);
229    } else if (multiplier instanceof Mass mass) {
230      return times(mass);
231    } else if (multiplier instanceof MomentOfInertia momentOfInertia) {
232      return times(momentOfInertia);
233    } else if (multiplier instanceof Mult<?, ?> mult) {
234      return times(mult);
235    } else if (multiplier instanceof Per<?, ?> per) {
236      return times(per);
237    } else if (multiplier instanceof Power power) {
238      return times(power);
239    } else if (multiplier instanceof Temperature temperature) {
240      return times(temperature);
241    } else if (multiplier instanceof Time time) {
242      return times(time);
243    } else if (multiplier instanceof Torque torque) {
244      return times(torque);
245    } else if (multiplier instanceof Velocity<?> velocity) {
246      return times(velocity);
247    } else if (multiplier instanceof Voltage voltage) {
248      return times(voltage);
249    } else {
250      // Dimensional analysis fallthrough or a generic input measure type
251      // Do a basic unit multiplication
252      return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit()).ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
253    }
254  }
255
256  /**
257   * Multiplies this measure by an acceleration and returns the resulting measure in the most
258   * appropriate unit.
259   *
260   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
261   * @return the multiplication result
262   */
263  default Measure<?> times(Acceleration<?> multiplier) {
264    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
265        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
266  }
267
268  /**
269   * Multiplies this measure by an angle and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
270   * unit.
271   *
272   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
273   * @return the multiplication result
274   */
275  default Measure<?> times(Angle multiplier) {
276    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
277        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
278  }
279
280  /**
281   * Multiplies this measure by an angular acceleration and returns the resulting measure in the
282   * most appropriate unit.
283   *
284   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
285   * @return the multiplication result
286   */
287  default Measure<?> times(AngularAcceleration multiplier) {
288    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
289        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
290  }
291
292  /**
293   * Multiplies this measure by an angular momentum and returns the resulting measure in the most
294   * appropriate unit.
295   *
296   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
297   * @return the multiplication result
298   */
299  default Measure<?> times(AngularMomentum multiplier) {
300    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
301        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
302  }
303
304  /**
305   * Multiplies this measure by an angular velocity and returns the resulting measure in the most
306   * appropriate unit.
307   *
308   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
309   * @return the multiplication result
310   */
311  default Measure<?> times(AngularVelocity multiplier) {
312    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
313        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
314  }
315
316  /**
317   * Multiplies this measure by an electric current and returns the resulting measure in the most
318   * appropriate unit.
319   *
320   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
321   * @return the multiplication result
322   */
323  default Measure<?> times(Current multiplier) {
324    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
325        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
326  }
327
328  /**
329   * Multiplies this measure by a distance and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
330   * unit.
331   *
332   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
333   * @return the multiplication result
334   */
335  default Measure<?> times(Distance multiplier) {
336    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
337        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
338  }
339
340  /**
341   * Multiplies this measure by an energy and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
342   * unit.
343   *
344   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
345   * @return the multiplication result
346   */
347  default Measure<?> times(Energy multiplier) {
348    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
349        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
350  }
351
352  /**
353   * Multiplies this measure by a force and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
354   * unit.
355   *
356   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
357   * @return the multiplication result
358   */
359  default Measure<?> times(Force multiplier) {
360    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
361        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
362  }
363
364  /**
365   * Multiplies this measure by a frequency and returns the resulting measure in the most
366   * appropriate unit. This often - but not always - means implementations return a variation of a
367   * {@link Per} measure.
368   *
369   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
370   * @return the multiplication result
371   */
372  default Measure<?> times(Frequency multiplier) {
373    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
374        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
375  }
376
377  /**
378   * Multiplies this measure by a linear acceleration and returns the resulting measure in the most
379   * appropriate unit.
380   *
381   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
382   * @return the multiplication result
383   */
384  default Measure<?> times(LinearAcceleration multiplier) {
385    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
386        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
387  }
388
389  /**
390   * Multiplies this measure by a linear momentum and returns the resulting measure in the most
391   * appropriate unit.
392   *
393   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
394   * @return the multiplication result
395   */
396  default Measure<?> times(LinearMomentum multiplier) {
397    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
398        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
399  }
400
401  /**
402   * Multiplies this measure by a linear velocity and returns the resulting measure in the most
403   * appropriate unit.
404   *
405   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
406   * @return the multiplication result
407   */
408  default Measure<?> times(LinearVelocity multiplier) {
409    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
410        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
411  }
412
413  /**
414   * Multiplies this measure by a mass and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
415   * unit.
416   *
417   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
418   * @return the multiplication result
419   */
420  default Measure<?> times(Mass multiplier) {
421    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
422        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
423  }
424
425  /**
426   * Multiplies this measure by a moment of intertia and returns the resulting measure in the most
427   * appropriate unit.
428   *
429   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
430   * @return the multiplication result
431   */
432  default Measure<?> times(MomentOfInertia multiplier) {
433    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
434        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
435  }
436
437  /**
438   * Multiplies this measure by a generic multiplied measure and returns the resulting measure in
439   * the most appropriate unit.
440   *
441   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
442   * @return the multiplication result
443   */
444  default Measure<?> times(Mult<?, ?> multiplier) {
445    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
446        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
447  }
448
449  /**
450   * Multiplies this measure by a power and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
451   * unit.
452   *
453   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
454   * @return the multiplication result
455   */
456  default Measure<?> times(Power multiplier) {
457    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
458        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
459  }
460
461  /**
462   * Multiplies this measure by a generic ratio measurement and returns the resulting measure in the
463   * most appropriate unit.
464   *
465   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
466   * @return the multiplication result
467   */
468  default Measure<?> times(Per<?, ?> multiplier) {
469    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
470        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
471  }
472
473  /**
474   * Multiplies this measure by a temperature and returns the resulting measure in the most
475   * appropriate unit.
476   *
477   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
478   * @return the multiplication result
479   */
480  default Measure<?> times(Temperature multiplier) {
481    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
482        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
483  }
484
485  /**
486   * Multiplies this measure by a time and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
487   * unit.
488   *
489   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
490   * @return the multiplication result
491   */
492  default Measure<?> times(Time multiplier) {
493    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
494        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
495  }
496
497  /**
498   * Multiplies this measure by a torque and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
499   * unit.
500   *
501   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
502   * @return the multiplication result
503   */
504  default Measure<?> times(Torque multiplier) {
505    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
506        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
507  }
508
509  /**
510   * Multiplies this measure by a generic velocity and returns the resulting measure in the most
511   * appropriate unit.
512   *
513   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
514   * @return the multiplication result
515   */
516  default Measure<?> times(Velocity<?> multiplier) {
517    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
518        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
519  }
520
521  /**
522   * Multiplies this measure by a voltage and returns the resulting measure in the most appropriate
523   * unit.
524   *
525   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
526   * @return the multiplication result
527   */
528  default Measure<?> times(Voltage multiplier) {
529    return MultUnit.combine(unit(), multiplier.unit())
530        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
531  }
532
533  /**
534   * Multiplies this measure by a conversion factor, returning the converted measurement. Unlike
535   * {@link #times(Per)}, this allows for basic unit cancellation to return measurements of a known
536   * dimension.
537   *
538   * @param conversionFactor the conversion factor by which to multiply
539   * @param <Other> the unit type to convert to
540   * @param <M> the concrete return unit type. <strong>Note: the conversion factor's numerator unit
541   *     must return instances of this type from {@link Unit#ofBaseUnits(double)}}</strong>
542   * @return the converted result
543   */
544  @SuppressWarnings("unchecked")
545  default <Other extends Unit, M extends Measure<Other>> M timesConversionFactor(
546      Measure<? extends PerUnit<Other, U>> conversionFactor) {
547    return (M)
548        conversionFactor
549            .unit()
550            .getBaseUnit()
551            .numerator()
552            .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * conversionFactor.baseUnitMagnitude());
553  }
554
555  /**
556   * Multiplies this measure by another measurement of the inverse unit type (eg Time multiplied by
557   * Frequency) and returns the resulting dimensionless measure.
558   *
559   * @param multiplier the measurement to multiply by.
560   * @return the multiplication result
561   */
562  default Dimensionless timesInverse(
563      Measure<? extends PerUnit<DimensionlessUnit, ? extends U>> multiplier) {
564    return Value.ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() * multiplier.baseUnitMagnitude());
565  }
566
567  /**
568   * Multiplies this measure by another measurement of something over the unit type (eg Time
569   * multiplied by LinearVelocity) and returns the resulting measure of the ratio's dividend unit.
570   *
571   * @param ratio the measurement to multiply by.
572   * @param <Other> other unit that the results are in terms of
573   * @return the multiplication result
574   */
575  default <Other extends Unit> Measure<Other> timesRatio(
576      Measure<? extends PerUnit<? extends Other, U>> ratio) {
577    return ImmutableMeasure.ofBaseUnits(
578        baseUnitMagnitude() * ratio.baseUnitMagnitude(), ratio.unit().numerator());
579  }
580
581  /**
582   * Divides this measure by a unitless scalar and returns the result.
583   *
584   * @param divisor the measurement to divide by.
585   * @return the division result
586   */
587  Measure<U> divide(double divisor);
588
589  /**
590   * Divides this measure by a dimensionless scalar and returns the result.
591   *
592   * @param divisor the measurement to divide by.
593   * @return the division result
594   */
595  Measure<U> divide(Dimensionless divisor);
596
597  /**
598   * Divides this measurement by another measure and performs some dimensional analysis to reduce
599   * the units.
600   *
601   * @param divisor the unit to divide by
602   * @return the resulting measure
603   */
604  default Measure<?> divide(Measure<?> divisor) {
605    final double baseUnitResult = baseUnitMagnitude() / divisor.baseUnitMagnitude();
606
607    if (unit().getBaseUnit().equals(divisor.unit().getBaseUnit())) {
608      // These are the same unit, return a dimensionless
609      return Value.ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
610    }
611
612    if (divisor instanceof Dimensionless) {
613      // Dividing by a dimensionless, do a scalar division
614      return unit().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
615    }
616
617    if (unit() instanceof DimensionlessUnit) {
618      // Numerator is a dimensionless
619      if (divisor.unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> ratio) {
620        // Dividing by a ratio, return its reciprocal scaled by this
621        return ratio.reciprocal().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
622      }
623      if (divisor.unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> ratio) {
624        // Dividing by a Per<Time, U>, return its reciprocal velocity scaled by this
625        // Note: Per<Time, U>.reciprocal() is coded to return a Velocity<U>
626        return ratio.reciprocal().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
627      }
628    }
629
630    if (divisor.unit() instanceof PerUnit<?, ?> ratio
631        && ratio.numerator().getBaseUnit().equals(baseUnit())) {
632      // Numerator of the ratio cancels out
633      // N / (N / D) -> N * D / N -> D
634      // Note: all Velocity and Acceleration units inherit from PerUnit
635      return ratio.denominator().ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
636    }
637
638    if (divisor.unit() instanceof TimeUnit time) {
639      // Dividing by a time, return a Velocity
640      return VelocityUnit.combine(unit(), time).ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
641    }
642
643    if (divisor instanceof Acceleration<?> acceleration) {
644      return divide(acceleration);
645    } else if (divisor instanceof Angle angle) {
646      return divide(angle);
647    } else if (divisor instanceof AngularAcceleration angularAcceleration) {
648      return divide(angularAcceleration);
649    } else if (divisor instanceof AngularMomentum angularMomentum) {
650      return divide(angularMomentum);
651    } else if (divisor instanceof AngularVelocity angularVelocity) {
652      return divide(angularVelocity);
653    } else if (divisor instanceof Current current) {
654      return divide(current);
655    } else if (divisor instanceof Dimensionless dimensionless) {
656      // n.b. this case should already be covered
657      return divide(dimensionless);
658    } else if (divisor instanceof Distance distance) {
659      return divide(distance);
660    } else if (divisor instanceof Energy energy) {
661      return divide(energy);
662    } else if (divisor instanceof Force force) {
663      return divide(force);
664    } else if (divisor instanceof Frequency frequency) {
665      return divide(frequency);
666    } else if (divisor instanceof LinearAcceleration linearAcceleration) {
667      return divide(linearAcceleration);
668    } else if (divisor instanceof LinearVelocity linearVelocity) {
669      return divide(linearVelocity);
670    } else if (divisor instanceof Mass mass) {
671      return divide(mass);
672    } else if (divisor instanceof MomentOfInertia momentOfInertia) {
673      return divide(momentOfInertia);
674    } else if (divisor instanceof Mult<?, ?> mult) {
675      return divide(mult);
676    } else if (divisor instanceof Per<?, ?> per) {
677      return divide(per);
678    } else if (divisor instanceof Power power) {
679      return divide(power);
680    } else if (divisor instanceof Temperature temperature) {
681      return divide(temperature);
682    } else if (divisor instanceof Time time) {
683      return divide(time);
684    } else if (divisor instanceof Torque torque) {
685      return divide(torque);
686    } else if (divisor instanceof Velocity<?> velocity) {
687      return divide(velocity);
688    } else if (divisor instanceof Voltage voltage) {
689      return divide(voltage);
690    } else {
691      // Dimensional analysis fallthrough or a generic input measure type
692      // Do a basic unit multiplication
693      return PerUnit.combine(unit(), divisor.unit()).ofBaseUnits(baseUnitResult);
694    }
695  }
696
697  /**
698   * Divides this measure by a generic acceleration and returns the result in the most appropriate
699   * unit.
700   *
701   * @param divisor the measurement to divide by.
702   * @return the division result
703   */
704  default Measure<?> divide(Acceleration<?> divisor) {
705    return PerUnit.combine(unit(), divisor.unit())
706        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() / divisor.baseUnitMagnitude());
707  }
708

715  default Measure<?> divide(Angle divisor) {
716    return PerUnit.combine(unit(), divisor.unit())
717        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() / divisor.baseUnitMagnitude());

914  /**

916   * often - but not always - result in a {@link Per} type like {@link LinearVelocity} or {@link
917   * Acceleration}.
918   *
919   * @param divisor the measurement to divide by.
920   * @return the division result
921   */
922  default Measure<?> divide(Time divisor) {
923    return VelocityUnit.combine(unit(), divisor.unit())
924        .ofBaseUnits(baseUnitMagnitude() / divisor.baseUnitMagnitude());
925  }

959
960  /**
961   * Divides this measure by a ratio in terms of this measurement's unit to another unit, returning
962   * a measurement in terms of the other unit.
963   *
964   * @param divisor the measurement to divide by.
965   * @param <Other> the other unit that results are in terms of
966   * @return the division result
967   */
968  // eg Dimensionless / (Dimensionless / Time) -> Time
969  default <Other extends Unit> Measure<Other> divideRatio(
970      Measure<? extends PerUnit<? extends U, Other>> divisor) {
971    return ImmutableMeasure.ofBaseUnits(
972        baseUnitMagnitude() / divisor.baseUnitMagnitude(), divisor.unit().denominator());
973  }
974
975  /**
976   * Divides this measure by a time period and returns the result in the most appropriate unit. This
977   * is equivalent to {@code divide(period.of(1))}.
978   *
979   * @param period the time period measurement to divide by.
980   * @return the division result
981   */
982  default Measure<?> per(TimeUnit period) {
983    return divide(period.of(1));
984  }
985
986  /**
987   * Checks if this measure is near another measure of the same unit. Provide a variance threshold
988   * for use for a +/- scalar, such as 0.05 for +/- 5%.
989   *
990   * <pre>
991   *   Inches.of(11).isNear(Inches.of(10), 0.1) // true
992   *   Inches.of(12).isNear(Inches.of(10), 0.1) // false
993   * </pre>
994   *
995   * @param other the other measurement to compare against
996   * @param varianceThreshold the acceptable variance threshold, in terms of an acceptable +/- error
997   *     range multiplier. Checking if a value is within 10% means a value of 0.1 should be passed;
998   *     checking if a value is within 1% means a value of 0.01 should be passed, and so on.
999   * @return true if this unit is near the other measure, otherwise false
1000   */
1001  default boolean isNear(Measure<?> other, double varianceThreshold) {
1002    if (!this.unit().getBaseUnit().equivalent(other.unit().getBaseUnit())) {
1003      return false; // Disjoint units, not compatible
1004    }
1005
1006    // abs so negative inputs are calculated correctly
1007    var tolerance = Math.abs(other.baseUnitMagnitude() * varianceThreshold);
1008
1009    return Math.abs(this.baseUnitMagnitude() - other.baseUnitMagnitude()) <= tolerance;
1010  }
1011
1012  /**
1013   * Checks if this measure is near another measure of the same unit, with a specified tolerance of
1014   * the same unit.
1015   *
1016   * <pre>
1017   *     Meters.of(1).isNear(Meters.of(1.2), Millimeters.of(300)) // true
1018   *     Degrees.of(90).isNear(Rotations.of(0.5), Degrees.of(45)) // false
1019   * </pre>
1020   *
1021   * @param other the other measure to compare against.
1022   * @param tolerance the tolerance allowed in which the two measures are defined as near each
1023   *     other.
1024   * @return true if this unit is near the other measure, otherwise false.
1025   */
1026  default boolean isNear(Measure<U> other, Measure<U> tolerance) {
1027    return Math.abs(this.baseUnitMagnitude() - other.baseUnitMagnitude())
1028        <= Math.abs(tolerance.baseUnitMagnitude());
1029  }
1030
1031  /**
1032   * Checks if this measure is equivalent to another measure of the same unit.
1033   *
1034   * @param other the measure to compare to
1035   * @return true if this measure is equivalent, false otherwise
1036   */
1037  default boolean isEquivalent(Measure<?> other) {
1038    // Return false for disjoint units that aren't compatible
1039    return this.unit().getBaseUnit().equals(other.unit().getBaseUnit())
1040        && Math.abs(baseUnitMagnitude() - other.baseUnitMagnitude()) <= EQUIVALENCE_THRESHOLD;
1041  }
1042
1043  /** {@inheritDoc} */
1044  @Override
1045  default int compareTo(Measure<U> o) {
1046    return Double.compare(this.baseUnitMagnitude(), o.baseUnitMagnitude());
1047  }
1048
1049  /**
1050   * Checks if this measure is greater than another measure of the same unit.
1051   *
1052   * @param o the other measure to compare to
1053   * @return true if this measure has a greater equivalent magnitude, false otherwise
1054   */
1055  default boolean gt(Measure<U> o) {
1056    return compareTo(o) > 0;
1057  }
1058
1059  /**
1060   * Checks if this measure is greater than or equivalent to another measure of the same unit.
1061   *
1062   * @param o the other measure to compare to
1063   * @return true if this measure has an equal or greater equivalent magnitude, false otherwise
1064   */
1065  default boolean gte(Measure<U> o) {
1066    return compareTo(o) > 0 || isEquivalent(o);
1067  }
1068
1069  /**
1070   * Checks if this measure is less than another measure of the same unit.
1071   *
1072   * @param o the other measure to compare to
1073   * @return true if this measure has a lesser equivalent magnitude, false otherwise
1074   */
1075  default boolean lt(Measure<U> o) {
1076    return compareTo(o) < 0;
1077  }
1078
1079  /**
1080   * Checks if this measure is less than or equivalent to another measure of the same unit.
1081   *
1082   * @param o the other measure to compare to
1083   * @return true if this measure has an equal or lesser equivalent magnitude, false otherwise
1084   */
1085  default boolean lte(Measure<U> o) {
1086    return compareTo(o) < 0 || isEquivalent(o);
1087  }
1088
1089  /**
1090   * Returns the measure with the absolute value closest to positive infinity.
1091   *
1092   * @param <U> the type of the units of the measures
1093   * @param measures the set of measures to compare
1094   * @return the measure with the greatest positive magnitude, or null if no measures were provided
1095   */
1096  @SafeVarargs
1097  static <U extends Unit> Measure<U> max(Measure<U>... measures) {
1098    if (measures.length == 0) {
1099      return null; // nothing to compare
1100    }
1101
1102    Measure<U> max = null;
1103    for (Measure<U> measure : measures) {
1104      if (max == null || measure.gt(max)) {
1105        max = measure;
1106      }
1107    }
1108
1109    return max;
1110  }
1111
1112  /**
1113   * Returns the measure with the absolute value closest to negative infinity.
1114   *
1115   * @param <U> the type of the units of the measures
1116   * @param measures the set of measures to compare
1117   * @return the measure with the greatest negative magnitude
1118   */
1119  @SafeVarargs
1120  static <U extends Unit> Measure<U> min(Measure<U>... measures) {
1121    if (measures.length == 0) {
1122      return null; // nothing to compare
1123    }
1124
1125    Measure<U> max = null;
1126    for (Measure<U> measure : measures) {
1127      if (max == null || measure.lt(max)) {
1128        max = measure;
1129      }
1130    }
1131
1132    return max;
1133  }
1134
1135  /**
1136   * Returns a string representation of this measurement in a shorthand form. The symbol of the
1137   * backing unit is used, rather than the full name, and the magnitude is represented in scientific
1138   * notation.
1139   *
1140   * @return the short form representation of this measurement
1141   */
1142  default String toShortString() {
1143    // eg 1.234e+04 V/m (1234 Volt per Meter in long form)
1144    return String.format("%.3e %s", magnitude(), unit().symbol());
1145  }
1146
1147  /**
1148   * Returns a string representation of this measurement in a longhand form. The name of the backing
1149   * unit is used, rather than its symbol, and the magnitude is represented in a full string, not
1150   * scientific notation. (Very large values may be represented in scientific notation, however)
1151   *
1152   * @return the long form representation of this measurement
1153   */
1154  default String toLongString() {
1155    // eg 1234 Volt per Meter (1.234e+04 V/m in short form)
1156    return String.format("%s %s", magnitude(), unit().name());
1157  }
1158}
